page.title: 18MEDDLAR STUD
page.content: Meddlar Stud is named after a famous horse called Meddlar. The average price of a horse is 200,000 pounds and they buy and sell at Tattersalls, Newmarket The stud fee is 1,000 or 2,000 pounds per stallion. At present they have 46 horses but that changes through the year. They have 2 stallions, 19 mares, 4 fillies and 6 colts. The stud has 1250 acres and 100 loose boxes. They 12 workers and 2 part time. They change the feeding of mares in foal. To keep a mare in foal costs 13 pounds per day, a foal costs 11 pounds a day, a barren mare costs 9 pounds a day and a stallion 1200 pounds per year. Before the foals are 3 months old they have have blood tests and identfication cards. There have been tremendous changes on the stud since 1965.
